oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Geological Map of Davidson, Williamson and Maury Counties
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Maps
Agriculture; Davidson County (Tenn.); Maury County (Tenn.); Williamson County (Tenn.); Geology; Maps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This geological map of three Tennessee counties (Davidson, Williamson, and Maury) shows main waterways, county seats and towns, main roads, geographical identifications, and transversal sections of the land. Williamson County is outlined in red, while Maury and Davidson Counties are outlined in blue. The map appears to be hand-colored.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dr. Gerard Troost
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This map was printed in the Seventh Report (to the Tennessee General Assembly) of Dr. G. Troost, State Geologist. Troost, a native of Holland, was Tennessee's first state geologist. He was a professor of chemistry, geology, and mineralogy at the University of Nashville for 22 years. For more information on Troost, consult the article in the Peabody Journal of Education 30, no. 5 (March 1953) by Ellen V. Piers, called "Girard Troost, Pioneer Scientist," pages 265-274.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: S. Nye & Co., Printers to the House
